subject: Brake pedal upgrade kit
description_text:
I recently received the upgrade kit for my brake pedal as I bought one of
the earlier versions of your pedals, the new hydraulic fits in but I’m
having a problem with the brake shaft it self. I can fit all 3 of the
elastomers in, I tried to troubleshoot and realized that the joint
connecting to the pedal arm is different from the newer pedals and also see
that there is an included updated one in the pack. I cannot seam to figure
out how to take the joint off to put on the new joint.

conversations.body_text: Hi Thomas Momma,  Simply remove the M6 screws at these two positions on the brake pedal to take off the rod and replace the rod end.

I have done that but the rod end no matter how hard I try to twist or pull
off will not come off the rod end, is there any specific way I need to get
the rod end to loosen?

On Sat, Dec 27, 2025 at 8:20 PM service@simsonn.com
Hi Thomas Momma,  First, tighten the screws on both sides, then loosen the screws on one side. It’s possible that a slight rotation in the middle is making it difficult to remove.
